name: Nena Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In some ways, I feel like staying at the Hotel Nena was the first time TripAdvisor has let me down.
reviews.title: Mixed Review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the one hand, the hotel location and view from the rooftop restaurant was fantastic as described. On the other hand, the hotel room itself was a little disappointing. This hotel is an Istanbul Top 10 on TripAdvisor so it may be that I had higher expectations (for hotels in Istanbul) than I should have.
reviews.title: Great

likes.liked: — The view from the rooftop terrace
likes.disliked: — No teamaking facilities in the room (assume that's standard for the area & rating of hotel)

reviews.title: Decent place to stay
reviews.text: My review is colored by the double room we were in the first night. My husband described it as a "dank hole" and it prompted me to frantically search availability at the Istanbul Four Seasons - no matter the cost! It was terribly small with almost no light from the outside (or inside for that matter). The bath/shower was very rusty/unkept looking and I was afraid to look too closely. To the hotel's credit, we were moved to a different, triple room for the following 2 nights, which was much better size and light-wise, although still very basic. For example, I could feel the springs in what was a not-very-comfortable bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was, on the whole, quite good. The staff was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: The wonderful Hotel Nena

likes.liked: — The staff, the location, the view of the Blue Mosque from the restaurant and our room

reviews.text: In the final analysis, I think I should have searched harder to find the great location/view + a better room with a little more style, luxury and comfort.
reviews.title: Hotel Nena - highly recommended for a stay in Istanbul

likes.liked: — Location, professionalism and helpfulness of staff, brilliant view from terrace restaurant, great breakfast selection
likes.disliked: — There was nothing we didn't like.

reviews.text: We had a 3 night stay here and like other reviwers found the situation excellent for the sites. The rooms were on the small side, but perfectly adequate. Free internet and great breakfast looking out at the mosques. The recepion staff were very friendly and helpful, although very bemused by my request for a gin and tonic, none available at the bar, so we tried a martini and lemonade- their lemonade is fresh lemons, so it was a new experience! We had a laugh as we sat in the lovely conservatory area at the back.
reviews.title: Best reception staff i nTurkey!

reviews.text: We stayed for 10 nights at this wonderful hotel (Aug 2008). Its location is spot-on if you wish to be based in historic Sultanahmet, with the Agia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar and all the other landmarks of Istanbul just 'around the corner'. If you want to travel a little further, the local tram is 2 minutes away ....and excellent value too.
reviews.title: Hotel Nena - an absolute joy

likes.disliked: — I'm clutching at straws........no toaster ! (but the choice of fresh bread more than made up for that)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked thru the internet and communication with the hotel was superb. They arranged to pick us up from the airport and drop us off as well (no charge) and the hotel has everything you would need - safe deposit box (no charge), internet 24x7 in TV area (again no charge), staff who are very friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and spotless, breakfast an absolute joy (and the views from the terrace as I sipped my umpteenth tea ..... wow ! )
reviews.title: Hotel Nena for us

likes.liked: — Location, Price, Breakfast had so much variety, Staff were always pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, we had a fabulous stay and would recommend this hotel without hesitation.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed in Istanbul on 8 previous occcasions Hotel Nena is the most wonderful hotel we have stayed in.
reviews.title: Wonderful

likes.liked: — the location, the hospitality, the service we received
likes.disliked: — the shower--the entrance into to shower was too high for me to climb over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Nena for four nights and were extremely happy with the hotel and the service we received from the staff whilst we were there.
reviews.title: excellent location and hotel

reviews.text: The location is the biggest plus for this hotel. It is central to the Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque (about 5 minutes on foot in one direction) and again about 5 minutes on foot in the other direction to the Grand Bazaar! Very hard to get lost when you are so close.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

likes.liked: — The location and the charming terasse

reviews.text: The hotel is lovely, a garden terrace at the rear which is fully enclosed and a breathtaking view of the Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque and Marmara Sea from the breakfast room at the top floor. Breakfast was included on our stay and is a variety of ´Turkish treats and western foods with a selection of cheeses and fruits also.
reviews.title: A little Gem in Istanbul

likes.liked: — executive rooms are large and spacious
likes.disliked: — scraping of chairs on the floor above us very noisy in our room

reviews.text: Staff are excellent and helped us arrange a tour to Gallipoli and dinner at the Orient House.
reviews.title: Great location and staff

likes.disliked: — No place to sit in the rooms, but the lounge areas were great.

reviews.title: Fantastic Nena Hotel
reviews.text: Our room was an average size, bathroom was well maintained and clean.

We stayed at the Hotel Nena for 9 days in September. For the price we felt it is an average hotel in an excellent location (Sultanahmet), and were a little disappointed. However, this could be because we had just come from Santorini where we stayed in an excellent apartment (Enigma Apartments), and Athens where we stayed in a great hotel (Hotel Parthenon), and the building next door to the Nena in Istanbul was a construction site (it was being renovated).
reviews.title: Loved the location, hotel experience could have been better

likes.liked: — location, staff, value for money, dining terrace views
likes.disliked: — room size, mould in shower cubicle, noisy corridors

reviews.text: The rooms were at the “budget” end of the range, were on the 1st floor just above reception area, were a bit of a squeeze for 2 people, and without tea/coffee and ironing facilities. The bathroom in our room was small and had small areas of mould in some places in the shower cubicle, but had a great shower height which is important for tall people who get sick of having to bend over to shower in hotel rooms. The corridors on each floor are marble lined without carpet on the floor so any voices above normal quiet conversation level echo very loudly, particularly late at night.
reviews.title: Loved the Nena especially the staff

likes.disliked: — Call to prayer in the early hours from the mosque

reviews.text: Also, unfortunately for us, the building next door was being renovated so there was a lot of drilling and jack-hammering noise both during the day and well into the evening. For those like us who like to race around until mid-afternoon sight-seeing, and go back to the hotel for a siesta before taking off for the evening/night meal and entertainment, this was pretty well out of the question.
reviews.title: Highly recommend Nena Hotel for your next stay in Istanbul

likes.liked: — Location, outdoor area, friendly staff, free transfer

reviews.text: Having said this, the reception staff were excellent - always helpful, pleasant, and courteous, and they provide internet access for free. We had pre-arranged airport transfers through the hotel which were prompt and well worth it. The Roof Terrace breakfast/dining area has views of the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque to rival any hotel in the area, and the breakfast buffet (included in our room price) had a great range of both cold and hot foods. Breakfast on the terrace every morning was a great treat, and the location of the hotel is an absolute winner.
reviews.title: Loved the Nena

likes.liked: — superb service, rooftop view, comfortable beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Istanbul is absolutely mental, and for those who haven’t been there it’s a “Must Do” for your travel list. The people are friendly (particularly as most of them are trying to sell you something), although the younger men seem to have a bad tendency of standing uncomfortably close to western women, and take opportunities for the odd grope in big packed crowds when they think they won’t be caught.
reviews.title: Perfectly located, great service

description: Hotel Nena Istanbul, the luxury boutique hotel located at Sultanahmet. The magnificent historical places are nearby our hotel like Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar and many more... In our hotel with our friendly employee we provide high quality service and Turkish hospitality to make you feel at home. Hotel Nena offers 29 guest rooms, including 2 deluxe rooms with a great Istanbul view. We serve excellent open buffet breakfast at our Terrace Restaurant before you start to explore historical peninsula. No need to search come and enjoy...
